title: When is the 2019 John Lewis Christmas advert out and who will be in it?
text:
Christmas is coming! Kind of… (Picture: John Lewis & Partners/PA Wire)

We’re delighted and horrified to inform you that Christmas is, at the time of writing, just 75 days away.

While we’re only just dusting off our winter coats and drowning our sorrows over the dark nights with pumpkin lattes, we’re prepared to start engaging with one of the best parts of the festive season.

That’s right: Christmas adverts. Specifically, John Lewis’ festive slot, which pretty much marks the beginning of the annual countdown to Christmas.

So, when can we expect to see it, who might be starring in it and where can you watch previous ones?

Take a seat.

When is the John Lewis Christmas advert 2019 out?

The release date hasn’t been officially announced but if our sleuthing is anything to go by, we could expect to see it in the next month.

Last year’s advert featured Elton John (Picture: John Lewis & Partners/PA Wire)

The Monty the Penguin advert (2014) and Man on the Moon (2015) adverts both dropped on 6 November.

Advertisement

Advertisement

The 2016 (Buster the Boxer) and 2017 (Moz the Monster) adverts both dropped four days later on 10 November.

However, last year’s advert, The Boy and the Piano, featuring Elton John, dropped a bit of a spanner in the works, as it was released on 15 November.

If this year’s advert follows a similar schedule, we can expect to see it between 6 – 15 November, which by all accounts feels very soon.

We still hold a special place in our hearts for Monty (Picture: John Lewis)

Who is rumoured to be in this year’s John Lewis Christmas advert?

John Lewis haven’t yet confirmed who will be in this year’s advert, or what the heart-warming message will be.

Until 2018, the adverts often featured lower tempo covers of existing songs sung by artists including Ellie Goulding, Lily Allen, Aurora and Tom Odell.

Last year’s advert also bucked this trend featuring an original performance from Elton John.

Speculation has already started on Twitter, with Lewis Capaldi and Ed Sheeran featuring in some of the gossip surrounding who could be the star of the ad this year.

However, most of the comments have been on the humorous side with users joking about Brexit and Baby Shark making an appearance:

If I was making the John Lewis Christmas ad, I'd do a family torn apart by Brexit patching it up – a Christmas miracle! – to the sound of Blinded By Your Grace Pt 2 by Stormzy.

Which is why I don't get to make John Lewis Christmas ads. — Alice Beverton-Podcast (@alice) August 1, 2019

Advertisement

Advertisement

Lewis Capaldi doing a slowed-down, whispered Too Shy by Kajagoogoo as two shy reindeer meet and fall in love, then one of them falls off a roof — Lauren Turner (@thisislaurent) August 1, 2019

Truthfully, no-one knows which in our opinion, makes it all the more exciting!
